author: snichol
msg: Submitted by: Pavel Ausianik <Pavel_Ausianik@epam.com>
Reviewed by: Scott Nichol
Refer to: http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=12539
class org.apache.soap.Envelope causes unnecessary memory allocations

author: snichol
msg: Submitted by: Pavel Ausianik <Pavel_Ausianik@epam.com>
Reviewed by: Scott Nichol
Base64 encoded parameters decoded too slow. See
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=12510

author: snichol
msg: Use Hashtable instead of Map in echoMapArray, since Hashtable and Map
are now serialized distinctly.

author: snichol
msg: Do not emit a line separator after closing the response element.  This was
being parsed as a text node child of the SOAP Body element by some
implementations (SilkPerformer for .NET and Sun's SOAP tool kit were
reported), so this change should improve interop.  See
http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=soap-dev&m=103335375422356&w=2
for the mailing list thread.

author: snichol
msg: Add a serializer (PropertyBagSerializer) that can read SOAP compound
types into a Hashtable where the element names are the keys and the
element contents are the values, which means beans do not have to be created
for each compound type being deserialized.  Conversely, it can write a
Map similary, providing an alternative to the default Apache SOAP serialization
of Maps.
